main event: A Dutch merchant vessel, the M.V. Goedkind, reported seeing a very strange, bright, and fast-moving object over the Atlantic Ocean on October 18, 1958.
interesting points: The object was described as a very bright, white light giving the impression of a solid object, with a lighted connection that looked like a row of lighted portholes, and a steady bright light in the center.
The object was estimated to be about 1/2 mile wide and moving at a speed of around 1,000 to 1,200 mph.
The object was under perfect control and appeared to give off a phosphorescent glow.
The sighting lasted for about 30 seconds, and the captain intended to report it to the Dutch Navy.
The Air Technical Intelligence Center astronomers investigated the report and confirmed the finding.
sighted object: A very bright, white, fast-moving object with lights
witnesses: Captain and crew of the Dutch merchant vessel M.V. Goedkind
photographs: No photographs were present in the image
